lexUnit.name: shriek.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: utter a high-pitched piercing sound, cry, or words.

sentence.text: ` Keep your distance ! " she shrieked .
` I 'm pregnant ! " she shrieked .
` Here he is ! " she shrieks .
On our return to London , David Attenborough kindly came over to watch the rushes with us , and when he saw this particular episode he shrieked : " You fools !
` I do n't know , " he shrieked , the screams cut off by Farrell 's free hand .
` Do n't you dare stop me , you common little man ! " she shrieked .
` Him ! " shrieked Levine .
` Mildred Hubble 's down there ! " shrieked Ethel .
` I ca n't do that unless I know for sure , can I ? " shrieked Felicity .
` Murder , " shrieked the lady , overlooking the relevance of Angelina 's provoking statement .
` Stop doing that ! " shrieked Broadman , from under his table .
` Oh , Gawd , she 's goin' , " shrieked Rose .
` Out , demons ! " shrieked the landlord .
Plaster dust floated down from the ceiling making some people choke and one little girl shriek that it had got into her eyes .
She shrieked that he was to take his hands off her .
Ruth shrieked the word at her .
Morathi shrieked her protests at her son not being chosen but he calmed her and agreed that the selection was a good one .
` Girls ! ! ! " shrieks the man in horror .
She shrieked his name .
She almost shrieked the word .
The last words were shrieked at him as Doreen worked herself into a frenzy of rage which caused her to tremble violently .
The name was shrieked .
" Elsie Tanner 's here ! " was soon being excitedly shrieked in every nearby street .
There was a burst of laughter and the woman shrieked something that was lost in the hubbub .
Her temper sprang back into vivid life as she all but shrieked the words back at him , her fingers unconsciously curling themselves into the fists she 'd dearly love to use on him .
` You 're frightened of me , are n't you ? " she shrieked at him .
` You killed Sabine , " she shrieked at Joseph .
` Fucking bastard ! " he shrieked at the wheelhouse as he dragged himself up the slimy wall , earrings gleaming .
At this moment , Madam , who knew me , shrieked to me over the heads of the crowd : " You -- there -- please !
` It 's him ! " he shrieked to the others as he started the engine .
The others will come out tomorrow shrieking for Briant 's blood , just as these two have this evening .
Zahara shouted , and the others shrieked with laughter .
By the ` fifties we were taken over by Leavisites -- ghastly neurotics shrieking about maturity .
` My face , " he shrieked in a choked whisper , and sank his teeth into the wrist of the hand that was choking him .
